summary.purpose: Provides SVG icon factory functions for table UI controls: sort column indicators with directional variants, filter state indicators (empty/outline and slashed), and an export-to-Excel button icon with customizable dimensions.
summary.problem_solved: Encapsulates table-related SVG icons as parameterized functions that return JSX elements, eliminating inline SVG duplication and supporting visual state variations like sort direction and filter states for consistent table header controls.

exports.name: sortSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a sort direction indicator SVG icon with optional 180-degree rotation

exports.name: emptyFilterSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a filter indicator SVG icon with solid or outline appearance variants

exports.name: slashFilterSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating a slashed filter (no-filter) indicator SVG icon with customizable color and appearance

exports.name: exportToExcelSvg
exports.description_one_line: Factory function creating an export-to-Excel button SVG icon with customizable dimensions

symbols.name: sortSvg
symbols.description_one_line: Creates a sort direction arrow SVG icon that can optionally be rotated 180 degrees to indicate ascending/descending

params.name: upside_down
params.description: Optional flag to rotate the icon 180 degrees. When true, transforms the sort indicator from ascending to descending direction (or vice versa).

returns.description: An SVG element displaying a white sort direction arrow with conditional CSS transform rotation

details.what_it_does: Returns a JSX SVG element displaying a bidirectional sort arrow icon in white (#fff). The icon is 13x13 pixels and includes inline CSS for absolute positioning in table headers. When upside_down is true, applies a 180-degree CSS rotation transform to indicate reverse sort direction. The icon is optimized for use as a visual indicator in sortable table column headers.
details.rendered_ui_description: A 13x13px white SVG sort arrow positioned absolutely at top-[3px] left-1. Can be rotated 180 degrees via CSS to show ascending or descending direction. Commonly placed in table header cells next to sortable column names.

minimal_correct.title: Basic ascending sort indicator

extensive_correct.title: Conditional sort direction in sortable table

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using string as parameter
incorrect.why_incorrect: The upside_down parameter expects a boolean value. Passing a string like 'upside_down' will be truthy and cause unexpected rotation. Pass true or false explicitly, or use a boolean variable.

symbols.name: emptyFilterSvg
symbols.description_one_line: Creates a filter state indicator SVG icon that can render in solid or outline appearance variants

params.name: solid
params.description: Optional flag determining the filter icon appearance. When true, renders a solid filled filter shape. When false or undefined, renders an outline filter icon.

returns.description: A JSX.Element containing an SVG element displaying a filter indicator icon in white (#fff), wrapped in a React Fragment

details.what_it_does: Returns a JSX Fragment containing either a solid or outline filter SVG icon, both 13x13 pixels in white (#fff). Used to indicate filter states in table headers. The solid variant shows a completely filled filter shape, while the outline variant shows a filter outline with internal structure. Both variants use complex SVG path data and are optimized for display in table controls.
details.rendered_ui_description: A 13x13px white filter icon with two visual variants: solid (filled) for active filter state and outline for inactive/empty filter state. Typically placed in table headers to indicate whether filters are applied.

minimal_correct.title: Basic filter indicator - outline variant

extensive_correct.title: Conditional filter state indicator

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Trying to pass CSS classes
incorrect.why_incorrect: The emptyFilterSvg function only accepts a boolean parameter for the solid/outline variant. Passing strings or CSS class names will not work as expected. Use true/false to toggle between solid and outline appearances.

symbols.name: slashFilterSvg
symbols.description_one_line: Creates a slashed filter (no-filter) indicator SVG icon with customizable color and appearance variants

params.name: solid
params.description: Optional flag determining the icon variant. When true, renders a solid slashed filter. When false or undefined, renders an outline slashed filter.

params.name: color
params.description: Optional CSS color string for the SVG fill. Defaults to white (#fff) when not provided. Can accept any valid CSS color value.

returns.description: A JSX.Element containing a wrapped SVG element displaying a slashed/diagonal-line-through filter icon

details.what_it_does: Returns a JSX element containing an SVG icon representing a filter with a diagonal slash through it, indicating 'no filter' or 'filter disabled' state. The icon is 18x20 pixels and wrapped in a div with negative margins (mt-[-4px] mr-[-2px]) for precise positioning adjustment. Supports both solid and outline variants with customizable fill color. The solid variant shows a completely filled pattern, while the outline shows the stroke outline.
details.rendered_ui_description: An 18x20px SVG icon displaying a filter symbol crossed out with a diagonal slash. Commonly used to indicate that filtering is disabled or cleared. Color defaults to white (#fff) for use on dark backgrounds.

minimal_correct.title: Basic no-filter indicator

extensive_correct.title: Conditional filter indicator with color

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Wrong parameter order
incorrect.why_incorrect: Parameters are positional: solid (boolean) comes first, color (string) comes second. Reversing them will cause the color string to be evaluated as a boolean (truthy) and the boolean to be ignored. Pass them in the correct order.

symbols.name: exportToExcelSvg
symbols.description_one_line: Creates an export-to-Excel action button SVG icon with customizable dimensions and viewBox

params.name: width
params.description: Optional CSS width value for the SVG element. Defaults to '18' pixels when not provided.

params.name: height
params.description: Optional CSS height value for the SVG element. Defaults to '18' pixels when not provided.

params.name: viewBox
params.description: Optional SVG viewBox attribute defining the coordinate system. Defaults to '0 0 150.000000 150.000000' when not provided.

returns.description: An SVG element displaying a spreadsheet/Excel export icon in white (#ffffff)

details.what_it_does: Returns an SVG element representing an Excel spreadsheet or export icon in white (#ffffff). The icon is designed to fit a 150x150 viewBox but can be resized via width, height, and viewBox props. The default display size is 18x18 pixels. The SVG uses complex path data to render a spreadsheet-like icon. Useful for buttons that trigger CSV or Excel file exports.
details.rendered_ui_description: A white Excel/spreadsheet icon suitable for export action buttons. Default 18x18px size is optimized for toolbar and header buttons. Can be resized to fit various UI contexts.

minimal_correct.title: Basic export button with default dimensions

extensive_correct.title: Export with custom dimensions for different contexts

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using pixel units in dimension strings
incorrect.why_incorrect: SVG width and height attributes expect numeric values or unitless numbers. While '18px' may work in some contexts, it's cleaner and more standard to pass '18' without the pixel unit. The SVG rendering will automatically apply the correct scaling.
